flags.name: scripted
flags.comment: the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.

flags.name: invert
flags.comment: result of function is one minus actual result

flags.name: always active
flags.comment: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

fields.name: period
fields.comment: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

fields.name: scale period by
fields.comment: multiply this function by the above period

fields.name: scale function by
fields.comment: multiply this function by the result of the above function

fields.name: wobble function
fields.comment: the curve used for the wobble

fields.name: wobble period
fields.comment: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

fields.name: wobble magnitude
fields.comment: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

fields.name: square wave threshold
fields.comment: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

fields.name: step count
fields.comment: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

fields.name: sawtooth count
fields.comment: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

fields.name: scale result by
fields.comment: multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

fields.name: bounds mode
fields.comment: controls how the bounds, below, are used

fields.name: turn off with
fields.comment: if the specified function is off, so is this function

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: multiplayer team index
fields.comment: on a multiplayer map, this determines which team the vehicle belongs to for custom vehicle sets.

flags.name: slayer default
flags.comment: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a slayer game

flags.name: ctf default
flags.comment: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a ctf game

flags.name: king default
flags.comment: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a king game

flags.name: oddball default
flags.comment: vehicle will spawn when default vehicle set is used in a oddball game

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.name: slayer allowed
flags.comment: vehicle can spawn in a slayer game

flags.name: ctf allowed
flags.comment: vehicle can spawn in a ctf game

flags.name: king allowed
flags.comment: vehicle can spawn in a king game

flags.name: oddball allowed
flags.comment: vehicle can spawn in a oddball game

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.comment: unused

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

flags.name: unused
flags.comment: unused

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: desired permutation
fields.comment: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

fields.name: sequence ID
fields.comment: identifies this move position as belonging to a sequence, only actors whose starting locations match this sequence ID can use it (zero = no sequence)

fields.name: sequence ID
fields.comment: which move position sequence we can use (zero = no specific sequences)

fields.name: return state
fields.comment: state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do

fields.name: initial state
fields.comment: state that this actor starts in

fields.name: initial state
fields.comment: state that this actor starts in

fields.name: return state
fields.comment: state that this actor will return to when it has nothing to do

fields.name: unique leader type
fields.comment: what kind of leader this squad has (e.g. a sarge for marines) - 'normal' is based on the size of the squad, 'random' always creates a leader, or you can specify an individual type

fields.name: normal diff count
fields.comment: initial number of actors on normal difficulty

fields.name: insane diff count
fields.comment: initial number of actors on insane difficulty (hard difficulty is midway between normal and insane)

fields.name: respawn min actors
fields.comment: minimum number of actors alive at once (will spawn instantly if less than this number)

fields.name: respawn max actors
fields.comment: maximum number of actors alive at once (never spawns above this number)

fields.name: respawn total
fields.comment: total number to respawn (zero = infinite)

fields.name: respawn delay
fields.comment: delay between respawning actors in this squad

fields.name: manual bsp index
fields.comment: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

fields.name: respawn delay
fields.comment: delay between respawning actors in this encounter

flags.name: allow initiative
flags.comment: lets an actor decide to stop following its commands and attack an enemy

flags.name: allow targeting
flags.comment: lets an actor shoot at enemies while following its commands

flags.name: disable looking
flags.comment: stops an actor from turning, stopping or looking around in response to stimuli received while following its commands

flags.name: disable communication
flags.comment: stops an actor from communicating while following its commands

flags.name: disable falling damage
flags.comment: makes an actor not take any damage from falling while following its commands

flags.name: manual bsp index
flags.comment: set if the command list is manually attached to a specific bsp

fields.name: manual bsp index
fields.comment: structure bsp index that this encounter belongs to... ignored unless 'manual bsp index' flag is checked. if this flag is not checked, the structure bsp is found automatically (may fail in areas of overlapping geometry)

fields.name: animation graph
fields.comment: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

flags.name: optional
flags.comment: the conversation can continue even if nobody for this participant was found

flags.name: has alternate
flags.comment: if nobody for this participant can be found, we use a participant marked as 'is alternate' instead, e.g. someone from over the radio

flags.name: is alternate
flags.comment: this participant is only used if some participant in this conversation was marked as 'has alternate' could not be found

fields.name: use this object
fields.comment: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

fields.name: set new name
fields.comment: once we pick a unit, we name it this

flags.name: wait after until told to advance

fields.name: addressee participant
fields.comment: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'

flags.name: stop if death
flags.comment: this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies

flags.name: stop if damaged
flags.comment: an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged

flags.name: stop if visible enemy
flags.comment: an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy

flags.name: stop if alerted to enemy
flags.comment: an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy

flags.name: player must be visible
flags.comment: this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player

flags.name: stop other actions
flags.comment: participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation

flags.name: keep trying to play
flags.comment: if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play

flags.name: player must be looking
flags.comment: this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

fields.name: trigger distance
fields.comment: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

fields.name: run-to-player dist
fields.comment: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

fields.name: CAN'T USE
fields.comment: set me!! me!!!  i do something cool!!!  you'll be happy forever if there this tag reference is filled in!  don't believe the lies!!! LIESSSS!!!!!!!!  YESS, MY PRECIOUSSSSS, LIESSSS...

flags.name: cortana hack
flags.comment: sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry

flags.name: use demo UI
flags.comment: uses alternate UI collection for demo
